intro: Peucedanum aragonense, commonly known as the Aragon fennel, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Peucedanum aragonense is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is valued for its medicinal properties.
